recommendations.title: Courage, Defiance, And Sacrifice: The Life & Legacy Of Warrior Queen Rani Durgavati
recommendations.excerpt: When you examine mainstream history, you’ll see that the narratives of remarkable women have often been relegated to the periphery, overshadowed by the dominant accounts of male figures and their exploits.

recommendations.title: Will New Tech End the Need for Human Pregnancy?
recommendations.excerpt: We are five to ten years from a partial artificial womb for humans, according to estimates.

recommendations.title: How the World’s Freakiest Watchmaker Dreamt Up His Wild New $230,000 Masterpiece
recommendations.excerpt: Max Büsser sits down in his first-ever standalone US shop to talk creating auction grails, anime robots, and being handsome.

recommendations.title: The Truth Is Out There: A Father’s Disappearance, Dark Family Secrets, and the Hunt for Bigfoot
recommendations.excerpt: Bruce Champagne stood in a small clearing next to a stump. It was mid-November 2022, and snow was already visible on the nearby mountains. All around Bruce were stands of reeds known as phragmites, some so tall they reached well over his head.

recommendations.title: Love beyond blood: A couple’s journey of parenting generations
recommendations.excerpt: Beyond childcare, the couple empowered women in the village, encouraging them to take up skill training and employment opportunities.

recommendations.title: Reparations fund ‘historic’, but real fight begins now: Climate campaigners
recommendations.excerpt: Experts say the loss and damage fund launched at COP28 is just the first step towards climate justice.

recommendations.title: What’s the Big Deal About Earth Getting 2°C Hotter?
recommendations.excerpt: The increase may sound inconsequential, but scientists say there are serious ramifications for life as we know it if the planet exceeds the climate target.

recommendations.title: The Year Fashion Was Robbed
recommendations.excerpt: From the Balmain runway to the mean streets of Tinder, brazen couture heists dominated 2023.

recommendations.title: Fevered Planet: How a Shifting Climate Is Catalysing Infectious Disease
recommendations.excerpt: As temperatures shift, animals move to different regions and pathogens have more opportunities to jump between hosts. Could the next pandemic be fuelled by an unstable climate?

recommendations.title: How to Kick People Off Your Wi-Fi Network
recommendations.excerpt: Once you’ve given someone your Wi-FI password, they have unlimited access to your Wi-Fi, and they can join your network on all their devices. That’s how it usually works, anyway. Here’s how to boot them off.

recommendations.title: ‘We and the Ukrainians Have the Same Enemy’: A Visit to the Border of Russia’s Other War
recommendations.excerpt: The conflict in Syria continues unabated, a sign of Moscow’s determination to outlast its enemies.

recommendations.title: Sea moss has been the standout health product of the year - so, does it actually work to boost gut health and immunity?
recommendations.excerpt: Sea moss might conjure images of colourful underwater corals and algae but did you know? It promises to impact your gut health if taken as a supplement and has been one of the standout wellness trends of the year, with searches up 158% year-on-year.

recommendations.title: A Path to Well-Being: Tap Into the Benefits of Spirituality
recommendations.excerpt: Celebrating something larger than ourselves is an inherent human capacity that can lead to improved mental health.

recommendations.title: Why the Entire AI World Was Talking About 'Q' This Week
recommendations.excerpt: After a mysterious announcement by Sam Altman, the AI industry is buzzing about what Q-star could mean.

recommendations.title: What Was It Like When the Last Antimatter Disappeared?
recommendations.excerpt: In the early stages of the hot Big Bang, matter and antimatter were (almost) balanced. After a brief while, matter won out. Here’s how.

recommendations.title: Why ‘Healthspan’ May Be More Important Than Lifespan
recommendations.excerpt: And how some experts are trying to extend it.

recommendations.title: Why solar-powered canoes could be good for the future of the rainforest
recommendations.excerpt: The Indigenous Achuar people in Ecuador's Amazon rainforest sail in six solar-powered canoes. And it's not just to save money on fuel — the trees of the rainforest will benefit too.

recommendations.title: We Asked 13 People What Finally Helped Them Get Over a Bad Breakup
recommendations.excerpt: Writing down your ex’s biggest red flags can put things in perspective.

recommendations.title: Two Easy Ways to Fix a Leaky Refrigerator Door
recommendations.excerpt: Try this before buying a new seal.

recommendations.title: Robert Downey Jr.’s Third Act: “He’s Lived a Complicated Life. He Understands the Stakes”
recommendations.excerpt: Following an Oscar-worthy turn in “Oppenheimer,” Downey’s inner circle size up the man and his considerable legacy.

recommendations.title: What is toxic ‘breadcrumbing’? Experts share signs and how to address it
recommendations.excerpt: They love me, they love me not — the phrase sounds like an innocent children’s game. But for some people looking for a relationship in the modern dating scene, a potential partner’s wavering commitment is a painful experience that can leave them torn between feeling hopeful and hopeless.

recommendations.title: The Best RPG of the Year Takes 80 Hours to Hit Its Stride
recommendations.excerpt: Or: how I learned to stop worrying and love the grind.

recommendations.title: Is Netflix’s New Hit Unethical?
recommendations.excerpt: Netflix’s latest hit is a “real” spin-off from its dystopian drama about contestants involved in a deadly gameshow. It’s proving addictive – but is it responsible?

recommendations.title: The secret to India's tiger population success
recommendations.excerpt: As India celebrates 50 years of its Project Tiger conservation scheme, we visit the reserves of Madhya Pradesh to see how its success has impacted a tiger population that once looked in danger of disappearing.

recommendations.title: This is how the world finally ends the HIV/AIDS pandemic
recommendations.excerpt: Putting the specific needs of individuals and communities at the heart of HIV/AIDS care, by harnessing behavioural science, is key to building on the progress already been made.

recommendations.title: Stolen fingerprints, empty bank accounts: How customers are paying for gaps in Aadhaar
recommendations.excerpt: A series of similar frauds have involved the misuse of stolen biometric details to steal money using the Aadhaar payments system.

recommendations.title: 11 Signs of Emotional Abuse in Relationships That You Should Never Overlook
recommendations.excerpt: It can be hard to recognize these signs and break this toxic cycle, but you deserve better.

recommendations.title: What Is Dark Tourism?
recommendations.excerpt: Travelers’ fascination with the macabre is not new.

recommendations.title: ‘Change’ over ethnic identity politics: Why MNF lost Mizoram
recommendations.excerpt: The Zoram People’s Movement romped home with its educated, untested candidates and the promise of ‘corruption-free governance’.

recommendations.title: The Year of ChatGPT and Living Generatively
recommendations.excerpt: In November last year, OpenAI launched a “low key research preview” called ChatGPT. What happened next transformed the tech industry—and perhaps humanity’s future.
